showerReviews.reviewText: The pool bottom is nice and clean and smooth this year.  The water slides are fully functional as well as the baby/toddler water features.  I have also witnessed the life guards (over the past few visits this summer) jump in to assist a …

We enjoyed visiting the Big Splash this summer. Membership was reasonably priced. They offer two slides, climbing walls, small kid area, changing rooms, showers, restrooms, and picnic area. There are plenty of lounge chairs and beach chairs to sit on. Be sure to check the dates of when they are open and closed.

locations.title: Marion Franklin Swimming Pool
locations.street: 2699 Lockbourne Rd "Was very clean an staff was very friendly"
locations.content: Marion Franklin Swimming Pool may offer shower facilities. Contact directly to confirm availability and pricing.

showerReviews.reviewText: I would have gave 5 stars but they need some snacks up in there. The staff was organized and polite. My two year old loved it, as did I. It was clean, and they made everyone follow rules. I heard the lifeguards get on too some kids for cursing. We will be regulars now. We really enjoyed ourselves.

It’s a place where I take my kids to swim. As far as safety goes, it’s not on the staff to keep MY children safe. That is on me as a parent. This is a public swimming pool at a cost that’s cheap enough for anyone who’s having hard times. Thank you for having a clean pool for my family to enjoy!

Pool is very clean and has many different depths for all ages.  The lifeguards are fanominal with the kids and so patient with swim lessons even at a young age.  Remand for everyone - price is unbeatable as well.

Clean water, lifeguards are attentive, comfortable lounge chairs, lots of grass, splash pad, lazy river, zero entry area & 2 huge slides. Vending machines & a different food truck each day, instead of a concession stand. Very worth the cost of a SU membership, or just pay the daily rate.
